TopicTitle: What's the point of blocking mods on win x64?

Articles.Content:
I can`t understand that. Well, win x64 is unstable, I know it and really sad about it (though I am using Linux version, that have no such problems). OK. But what`s the point of blocking and shutting mods on win x64?

Okay, you are boycott Squad for instability of win x64. Well. But why because of this must suffer regular players? They do not care about your struggle for Stability, Liberty, Equality, Fraternity and other %BigLetter%-ty. They just want to play in game with their favourite mods... but /gamedata/ is too big for x86 and KSP is crashing all the times, much more often than x64-version. Linux video drivers is not so good that I want, so I am understanding wish of big number of players to use Windows for playing KSP and other. Su, what the point? Except the struggle for stability.

[Moderator Edit: Many modders do not want to support their addons on Windows x64, because the issues are invariably due to bugs in the Unity3D game engine and not in KSP, so neither Squad or the modders themselves are able to address them.

Issues with Windows X64 should be reported to the Unity3D forums and bug tracker, not here.

As Unity3D matures, these issues will go away, like with any other software there are bugs, and these take man-hours and well written bug reports to put right.]

Just in case you edit that out for some reason...
